member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Threading.CancellationSeries
member.summary: Produces a series of objects such that requesting a new token causes the previously issued token to be cancelled.

remarks.para: Consuming code is responsible for managing overlapping asynchronous operations.
This class has a lock-free implementation to minimise latency and contention.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Threading.CancellationSeries.#ctor(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .
member.param: An optional cancellation token that, when cancelled, cancels the last issued token and causes any subsequent tokens to be issued in a cancelled state.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Threading.CancellationSeries.HasActiveToken
member.summary: Determines if the cancellation series has an active token which has not been cancelled.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Threading.CancellationSeries.CreateNext(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Creates the next in the series, ensuring the last issued token (if any) is cancelled first.
member.param: An optional cancellation token that, when cancelled, cancels the returned token.
member.returns:
A cancellation token that will be cancelled when either:
is called again
The token passed to this method (if any) is cancelled
The token passed to the constructor (if any) is cancelled
is called

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Threading.TaskExtensions.VerifyCompleted(System.Threading.Tasks.Task)
member.summary: Asserts the passed has already been completed.
member.remarks: This is useful for a specific case: sometimes you might be calling an API that is "sometimes" async, and you're calling it from a synchronous method where you know it should have completed synchronously. This is an easy way to assert that while silencing any compiler complaints.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Utilities.AsyncBatchingWorkQueue`2
member.summary:
A queue where items can be added to to be processed in batches after some delay has passed. When processing happens, all the items added since the last processing point will be passed along to be worked on. Rounds of processing happen serially, only starting up after a previous round has completed.
Failure to complete a particular batch (either due to cancellation or some faulting error) will not prevent further batches from executing. The only thing that will permanently stop this queue from processing items is if the passed to the constructor switches to .

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Utilities.AsyncBatchingWorkQueue`2._delay
member.summary: Delay we wait after finishing the processing of one batch and starting up on then.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Utilities.AsyncBatchingWorkQueue`2._equalityComparer
member.summary: Equality comparer uses to dedupe items if present.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Utilities.AsyncBatchingWorkQueue`2._processBatchAsync
member.summary: Callback to actually perform the processing of the next batch of work.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Utilities.AsyncBatchingWorkQueue`2._entireQueueCancellationToken
member.summary: Cancellation token controlling the entire queue. Once this is triggered, we don't want to do any more work at all.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Utilities.AsyncBatchingWorkQueue`2._cancellationSeries
member.summary: Cancellation series we use so we can cancel individual batches of work if requested. The client of the queue can cancel existing work by either calling directly, or passing to . Work in the queue that has not started will be immediately discarded. The cancellation token passed to will be triggered allowing the client callback to cooperatively cancel the current batch of work it is performing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Utilities.AsyncBatchingWorkQueue`2._gate
member.summary: Lock we will use to ensure the remainder of these fields can be accessed in a thread-safe manner. When work is added we'll place the data into . We'll then kick of a task to process this in the future if we don't already have an existing task in flight for that.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Utilities.AsyncBatchingWorkQueue`2._nextBatch
member.summary: Data added that we want to process in our next update task.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Utilities.AsyncBatchingWorkQueue`2._nextBatchCancellationToken
member.summary: CancellationToken controlling the next batch of items to execute.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Utilities.AsyncBatchingWorkQueue`2._uniqueItems
member.summary: Used if is present to ensure only unique items are added to .

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Utilities.AsyncBatchingWorkQueue`2._updateTask
member.summary: Task kicked off to do the next batch of processing of . These tasks form a chain so that the next task only processes when the previous one completes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Utilities.AsyncBatchingWorkQueue`2._taskInFlight
member.summary: Whether or not there is an existing task in flight that will process the current batch of . If there is an existing in flight task, we don't need to kick off a new one if we receive more work before it runs.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Utilities.AsyncBatchingWorkQueue`2.CancelExistingWork
member.summary: Cancels any outstanding work in this queue. Work that has not yet started will never run. Work that is in progress will request cancellation in a standard best effort fashion.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Utilities.AsyncBatchingWorkQueue`2.WaitUntilCurrentBatchCompletesAsync
member.summary: Waits until the current batch of work completes and returns the last value successfully computed from . If the last canceled or failed, then a corresponding canceled or faulted task will be returned that propagates that outwards.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Utilities.Delta.Compute``1(System.Collections.Immutable.ImmutableArray{``0},System.Collections.Immutable.ImmutableArray{``0})
member.summary: Compares and and returns the items in that are not in .

member.summary: Returns the directory portion of the given file path in normalized form.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Utilities.FilePathNormalizer.NormalizeCore(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char},System.Span{System.Char})
member.summary: Normalizes the given file path and writes the result in .
member.returns: Returns a tuple containing the start index and length of the normalized path within .

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Utilities.StringCache
member.summary: This class helps de-duplicate dynamically created strings which might otherwise lead to memory bloat.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Utilities.StringCache.ExfiltratingEqualityComparer
member.summary: This is a gross hack to do a sneaky and get the value inside the HashSet out given the lack of any Get operations in netstandard2.0. If we ever upgrade to 2.1 delete this and just use the built in TryGetValue method.
member.remarks: This is fragile on the ordering of the values passed to the EqualityComparer by HashSet. If that ever switches we have to react, if it becomes indeterminate we have to abandon this strategy.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Utilities.TagHelperCache.TryAddOrGet_NoLock(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Utilities.Checksum,Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Language.TagHelperDescriptor)
member.summary: Try to add the given tag helper to the cache. If it already exists, return the cached instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Utilities.UrlDecoder.CharToHexLookup
member.summary: Map from an ASCII char to its hex value, e.g. arr['b'] == 11. 0xFF means it's not a hex digit.
